; Fri, 15 Sep 2023 21:52:01 +0800 Luis Rubiales appears in court and denies sexual assault over World Cup kisshttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/15/luis-rubiales-appears-in-court-and-denies-sexual-assault-over-world-cup-kiss
;;2023-09-15T12:31:32Z;
;
;;路易斯·鲁维亚莱斯在马德里出庭后。
;

;前西班牙足协主席路易斯·鲁维亚莱斯出现在马德里的法庭上，他否认对世界杯冠军球员珍妮·埃尔莫索进行了性侵犯，并给了她一个吻;引发了一场关于性别歧视的全国和国际辩论;，并最终导致他五天前辞职。;

;鲁比亚莱斯坚称在西班牙女队上次赢得世界杯后他在埃尔莫索的嘴唇上亲吻了他月是双方同意的。

;

;埃尔莫索有;拒绝给予她许可;，并表示这一事件让她感到“脆弱，是侵略的受害者”。这名中场球员已对鲁维亚莱斯和;法官已命令;媒体集团，包括国家广播公司 RTVE，从各个角度提供该事件及其后果的视频片段。

;

;根据新规定根据去年出台的性犯罪立法，如果被判犯有性侵犯罪，这位前联邦主席可能会面临罚款或最高四年的监禁。

;

;埃尔莫索的律师是性别暴力方面的专家，他说她还要求法官为了她委托人的利益考虑采取预防措施。

;

;“我们正处于初步调查的早期阶段，”卡拉·瓦尔说。 “与州检察官一样，我们已要求采取预防措施。正如你可以想象的那样，珍妮深受这些事件的影响——她在体育场所遭受的羞辱行为玷污了这一体育地标。鉴于此，我们要求采取必要措施帮助她在情感上度过这一过程。”

;

;卢比亚莱斯最初试图抹去球队 1-0 战胜英格兰队后接吻引发的丑闻。在悉尼。但压力越来越大，导致他的;国际足联临时禁赛;，并提示;他的母亲开始绝食;，以抗议她所谓的对儿子的“不人道和嗜血”迫害。

;

;周日晚上，鲁维亚莱斯发表了一份挑衅性的声明，宣布他决定辞去西班牙皇家足协主席和欧足联副主席的职务。

;

;“在国际足联迅速暂停之后，在针对我的其余诉讼程序中，很明显我无法重返岗位，”他说。 “试图坚持下去不会给足协或西班牙足球带来任何积极的结果。”

;

;鲁比亚莱斯表示“那些权力会阻碍我的回归”，补充道：“我不希望西班牙足球因为这样一场不成比例的运动而受到损害。”

;

;他还表示，他将努力为自己洗清罪名。 “我相信真相，我将尽我所能确保它获胜。”

;

;该声明之前是一段来自;皮尔斯·摩根的电视采访;，其中鲁维亚莱斯宣布他将辞职。

;

;他告诉摩根：“我无法继续我的工作。我的父亲，我的女儿们，我和他们交谈过。他们知道这不是关于我的问题。”

;

;鲁比亚莱斯辞职的消息被誉为女权主义迟来的胜利。

;

;西班牙代理平等部长艾琳·蒙特罗 (Irene Montero) 对这一消息表示欢迎两个词“Se acabó”; – “结束了” – 指的是在接吻后分享的 #SeAcabó 标签，以及;在西班牙#MeToo时刻被用作战斗口号;。

; < p>;“我们生活的转变和改善是不可避免的，”代理劳工部长兼第二副总统 Yolanda Díaz ;写道社交媒体。 “我们与你站在一起，Jenni，也与所有女性站在一起。”

;

;西班牙世界杯冠军球员 - ;联合会证实;球员们仍在继续抵制。

; Fri, 15 Sep 2023 20:52:01 +0800 ‘The waters carried my son away in front of my eyes’: anguished Libyans mourn lost loved oneshttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/15/libya-floods-derna-relatives-mourn
;;2023-09-15T12:02:59Z;
;
;;救援队使用重型机械在德尔纳的残骸中挖掘
;

;Omar al-Rifadi 已自从周日灾难袭击利比亚德尔纳市以来，他一直在寻找失踪的 20 岁女儿，当时她在一场灾难性洪水中消失在黑暗中，这场洪水夺走了数千人的生命，并将许多人卷入大海。;

;“我步行去找她。我去了所有的医院和学校。但运气并没有站在我这一边，”这位 52 岁的老人说道，泪水从脸上流下来。

;

;里法迪说，他一直在洪水发生的当晚工作，洪水摧毁了地中海的大片地区。沿海城市。周日晚上，丹尼尔风暴倾盆大雨吞没了原本干涸的河床，导致两座维护不善的水坝倒塌。洪水冲毁了德尔纳市中心的整座建筑，而当时人们还在睡觉。

;

;里法迪再次拨通了妻子的电话。没有人回答。它被关闭了。他说：“我的家人中至少有 50 名成员，包括失踪者和已故者，均下落不明。”

; ;

;官员估计失踪人数约为 10,000 人。利比亚红新月会表示，近 2000 具尸体被冲入海中。无论如何，这都是一场可怕的灾难。

;

;周四下午，由于洪水，孩子们的衣服、玩具、家具、鞋子和其他物品散落在岸边。一只脚从一堆废墟下伸出来。街道上满是泥土，树木被连根拔起，数百辆汽车被撞毁，其中许多汽车侧翻或倒立。一辆车卡在了一座被拆除建筑的二楼阳台上。

;

;“我和妻子幸存下来，但我失去了我的兄弟，”38 岁的工程师塞勒姆·奥马尔 (Salem Omar) 说。 “我哥哥住在市中心，大部分破坏都是在那里发生的。我们还没有找到他的尸体。我们担心尸体可能会感染严重疾病。”

;

;在他的公寓里发现了两具陌生人的尸体。当他讲话时，来自阿拉伯联合酋长国的一支搜救队在附近工作，找到了他邻居的尸体。 “她是我的阿姨，阿米娜。愿她安息，”他说。

;

;“现在有数万人无家可归。我们需要国际援助。利比亚没有应对此类灾难的必要经验。”

;

;从德尔纳上方的高地地区可以明显看出破坏的程度。这里曾经是市中心，人口稠密，沿着季节性的新月形河流而建。建筑物被冲走，城市景观也被抹去，现在它被淹没在阳光下闪闪发光的泥水中。

;

;德尔纳市市长阿卜杜勒莫内姆·盖蒂 (Abdelmonem al-Ghaithi) 表示，该市的死亡人数可能达到根据被淹没的社区数量，数量在 20,000 到 25,000 之间。风暴丹尼尔还淹没了附近地区，包括苏萨海滨度假胜地。

; ;

;盖蒂说，救援队现已从埃及、突尼斯、阿联酋、土耳其和卡塔尔抵达德尔纳。 “我们实际上需要专门的尸体检索团队，”他说。 “由于废墟下和水中有大量尸体，我担心疫情可能会在城市蔓延。”

;

;联合国国际移民组织报告称，至少有 3 万人流离失所。德尔纳挨饿无家可归。

;

;由于利比亚这个拥有 700 万人口的国家的政治分裂，救援行动变得复杂。自 2011 年北约支持的起义 ;推翻穆阿迈尔·卡扎菲;。利比亚没有中央政府，有两个平行的政府。首都的黎波里有一个国际公认的政府，还有一个由军事指挥官哈利法·哈夫塔尔领导的东部政府。

; ;

;政治之外还有人间悲剧。一个家庭俯瞰德尔纳山谷的房屋被冲走，失去了 40 名亲戚。在另一个令人心碎的故事中，一位父亲自己活了下来，却无奈地看着自己唯一的儿子死在自己面前。这位不愿透露姓名的男子在人满为患的德尔纳医院内发表讲话，医院里挤满了伤员。

;

;“凌晨 2 点，洪水达到危险水平并到达我们家后，我去接我的孩子。儿子，”父亲回忆道，语气明显困难。 “我儿子在朋友家。在我到达他身边不久，海水淹没了我们，将我们推向屋顶。我们战斗了几个小时。

;

;“最终，水把我儿子在我眼前冲走了，把他的头撞到了门上。他一直被困在那里直到早上。当我失去唯一的儿子时，我从他那里听到的最后一句话是“爸爸，请原谅我”。他是一名大学生。”

; ;

;德尔纳此前曾遭受过自然灾害，其中包括 1941 年的洪水，二战期间驻扎在该市郊区的德国军队遭受重大损失。 1959 年和 1968 年又发生了一次灾难性洪水，1986 年又发生了一次洪水，虽然很严重，但由于大坝的存在而得到缓解，大坝在防止城市受损方面发挥了至关重要的作用。

;

;周日的洪水使这些情况变得很糟糕。维持水坝崩塌。该国双方都;呼吁调查发生的事情;，以及疏忽是否起了作用。无论原因是什么，这都是自上世纪初有记录以来最严重的灾难。就物质和人员损失而言，其后果与之前的任何一次洪水都无法相提并论。

;

;来自利比亚东部和西部各地的救援队在到达德尔纳和其他山区城市的受影响社区时面临着困难。通往他们的大部分道路和桥梁都已经倒塌。德尔纳市内没有任何通讯，电话和互联网服务也中断了。

;

;这座城市本身被洪水分成了两个独立的两半，风暴留下了残余的洪流，救援队可用的资源有限。这导致利比亚当局紧急请求国际援助，以拯救该市及其人民的残存。

; Fri, 15 Sep 2023 20:22:01 +0800 TikTok fined €345m for breaking EU data law on children’s accountshttps://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/sep/15/tiktok-fined-345m-for-breaking-eu-data-law-on-childrens-accounts
;;2023-09-15T12:00:00Z;
;
;;智能手机上的 tiktok 徽标
;

;TikTok 因破坏而被罚款 3.45 亿欧元（2.96 亿英镑）欧盟数据法处理儿童账户的问题，包括未能保护未成年用户的内容不被公众看到。

;

;在整个欧盟范围内监管 TikTok 的爱尔兰数据监管机构表示，这家中国拥有的视频应用程序已承诺多次违反 GDPR 规则。

;

;它发现 TikTok 通过以下方式违反了 GDPR：默认将儿童用户的帐户置于公共设置；允许公众对这些账户发表评论；不检查通过“家庭配对”计划访问儿童帐户的成年人是否是父母或监护人；并且没有正确考虑平台上放置在公共环境中的 13 岁以下儿童所面临的风险。

;

;爱尔兰数据保护委员会 (DPC) 表示，13 岁至 17 岁之间的用户被引导通过默认情况下，他们的帐户被设置为公开，这意味着任何人都可以看到帐户的内容或对其进行评论。它还发现，“家庭配对”方案允许成人控制儿童的帐户设置，但没有检查与儿童用户“配对”的成人是否是父母或监护人。

;
;

;;相关：;;TikTok 下针对儿童数据使用的调查;

;
;

;DPC 裁定 TikTok 的最低用户年龄为 13 岁，没有适当考虑获得访问权限的未成年用户所面临的风险到平台。它表示，默认公开设置流程允许任何人“查看这些用户发布的社交媒体内容”。

;

;Duet 和 Stitch 功能允许用户将其内容与其他 TikTokers 结合起来。 17 岁以下儿童也默认启用。然而，DPC 发现其验证用户年龄的方法并未违反 GDPR。

;

;DPC 的决定是在 TikTok 被 ;4 月份，英国数据监管机构因非法处理 140 万岁以下儿童的数据而被罚款 1270 万英镑; 13名未经家长同意使用其平台的人。信息专员表示，TikTok 在检查谁在使用该平台方面“几乎没有采取任何行动”。

;

;TikTok 表示，调查考察了该公司 2020 年 7 月 31 日至 12 月 31 日期间的隐私设置，并表示对询问中提出的问题进行了解答。自 2021 年以来，默认情况下，所有针对 13 至 15 岁儿童的现有和新 TikTok 帐户均已设置为私有，这意味着只有获得用户批准的人才能查看其内容。

;

;TikTok 表示：“我们谨表示不同意该决定，特别是罚款的数额。 DPC 的批评主要集中在三年前的功能和设置上，而我们在调查开始之前就对其进行了更改，例如默认将所有 16 岁以下的帐户设置为私人帐户。”

;

; DPC 还承认其决定的某些方面已被欧洲数据保护委员会否决，该委员会由欧盟成员国数据和隐私监管机构组成。这意味着它必须包括德国监管机构提出的一项调查结果，即使用“黑暗模式”（诱导用户进行某些行为或做出特定选择的欺骗性网站和应用程序设计的术语）违反了关于公平处理个人数据的 GDPR 条款。数据。

; Fri, 15 Sep 2023 20:22:01 +0800 Spain’s World Cup-winning squad still refuse to play for national teamhttps://www.theguardian.com/football/2023/sep/15/spain-world-cup-winning-underline-refusal-to-play-for-national-team-football
;;2023-09-15T10:56:31Z;
;
;;蒙特塞·托梅（左）被任命为西班牙女足新任主教练。
;< p>;西班牙足球联合会周五表示，西班牙世界杯冠军球员继续拒绝为女足国家队效力，就在新教练蒙特塞·托梅宣布她的第一支球队的几个小时前。

;

;Tomé现在必须决定是继续征召前锋球员，还是选择一支完全不同的球队参加即将于 9 月 22 日至 26 日对阵瑞典和瑞士的国家联赛。

;
;

;;相关：< /span>;;码头摩根软弱的提问方式让鲁比亚莱斯显得很合理 | Suzanne Wrack;

;
;

;西班牙女足几乎没有机会庆祝她们最伟大的足球成就，因为前足协主席路易斯·鲁维亚莱斯在亲吻球员珍妮·埃尔莫索时引起了轩然大波在悉尼举行的颁奖典礼上，这句话被挂在嘴边。

;

;在接吻后的几天里，23 名球员对他随后拒绝下台的回应宣布，他们不会再次为自己的国家队效力，除非联合会进行深度改革。改革并有了新的领导层。

;

;此后，联合会一直处于剧变之中。鲁维亚莱斯首先被足球管理机构国际足联停职，然后他的临时替代者解雇了不受球员欢迎的女足国家队教练豪尔赫·维尔达。鲁维亚莱斯本人最终在巨大的压力下辞职。

;

;许多人预计维尔达的解雇和鲁比亚莱斯的退出将为球员的回归扫清道路。但球员们似乎希望做出更多改变，尽管他们没有公开具体要求。

;

;球员们上个月通过 Futrpo 工会表示，“如果现在的情况发生，他们将不会回到西班牙队踢球”。领导力继续”，并要求“真正的结构性变革，帮助国家队继续发展。”

;

;去年，15 名球员也提出了类似的反抗，要求维尔达提供更多“专业”教练。以鲁维亚莱斯为首的足协坚决支持维尔达，其中只有三名球员态度软化，最终被纳入世界杯阵容。

;

;然而，悄悄地，球员的反抗似乎确实带来了一些变化。工作人员增加到60多人，陪同球队前往澳大利亚和新西兰，球队乘坐包机，球员们也得到了帮助携带家人的资金。带孩子的球员也有时间陪伴他们。

;

;随着维尔达最大的支持者鲁维亚莱斯的离开，联合会在第二次叛乱中更加充分地站在球员一边。西班牙足协聘请了他的前助理托梅来接替维尔达的位置，担任西班牙女队第一位女教练。

;

;两届金球奖得主、西班牙中场球员亚历克西娅·普特拉斯周三表示，球员们希望进行彻底的改革。

;

;“我们要求做出改变，这样无论是在足球界还是足球界之外，女性都不应再次经历贬低、不尊重或虐待的情况，”亚历克西娅说。 “我们需要各机构的共识、勇气和领导力。这就是为什么我们不会就此止步。”

;

;卢比亚莱斯周五在一名西班牙法官面前作证，调查国家检察官指控他用亲吻对埃尔莫索进行性侵犯的指控。他说这个吻是双方自愿的，但埃尔莫索一再否认这一点。

; Fri, 15 Sep 2023 19:22:01 +0800 Tata Steel seals £500m UK support package but big job losses fearedhttps://www.theguardian.com/business/2023/sep/15/tata-steel-seals-500m-uk-support-package-but-big-job-losses-feared
;;2023-09-15T10:20:05Z;
;
;;威尔士塔尔伯特港塔塔钢铁厂的钢铁生产线上，一卷卷钢离开卷材箱.
;

;英国政府已同意向塔塔钢铁公司提供 5 亿英镑的一揽子支持计划，以确保塔尔伯特港钢铁厂的未来，工会称该协议将产生“毁灭性后果”，预计将有多达 3,000 名工人失去工作。

;

;印度塔塔集团拥有英国最大的南威尔士钢铁厂，预计也将注资约 7.25 亿英镑，帮助其转向更绿色的生产方式。

; < p>;该国最大的钢铁生产商在英国拥有约 8,000 名员工，其中约一半员工位于塔尔伯特港，该公司曾警告称，如果无法就财务支持方案达成一致，该公司将面临工厂关闭的风险。

; Fri, 15 Sep 2023 18:52:01 +0800 Toxic chemicals banned by EU since Brexit still in use in UKhttps://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/sep/15/toxic-chemicals-banned-by-eu-since-brexit-still-in-use-in-uk
;;2023-09-15T09:44:24Z;
;
;;一个人在肩膀上纹身花卉图案
;

;几种已被禁止的有毒化学物质据活动人士透露，自英国脱欧以来，欧盟仍允许在英国使用该产品，因为活动人士表示，较低的标准使公众健康面临风险。

;

;英国尚未加入欧盟化学品法规;自 2021 年起;有一个自己的方案，称为 Reach。自英国脱欧以来，欧盟已通过 8 项限制使用危险化学品的规则，另有 16 项规则正在酝酿之中。英国当时尚未禁止任何物质，只考虑两项限制，即铅弹药和纹身墨水中的有害物质。

;

;在禁止化学品之前，通常会列出“含量非常高的物质”。关注”清单。 ;英国名单;的最后一次添加是在三年多前的 2020 年 6 月。随后，欧洲化学品管理局将 ;26 种物质;添加到其等效列表中。

;

;这些是主要是致癌或影响生殖系统的物质，并且在环境中持久存在并具有生物累积性。当某种化学品被添加到欧盟清单中时，公司有义务立即向消费者提供有关安全使用水平的信息。它还使这些物质符合进一步的监管或禁令。

;

;Chem Trust 慈善机构的 Chloe Alexander 表示：“欧盟的制度在推动创新以寻找更安全的物质替代品方面发挥着非常有效的作用在该清单上，因为该清单是一个迹象，表明可能会对这些物质进行进一步的监管。还有放松管制的动力；英国现在的证据门槛更高。在采取监管行动之前需要进行无休止的审查。

;

;“他们研究了欧盟正在做的事情并说：我们需要更多证据。一切都发生得慢得多。欧盟有非常彻底的风险评估，世界各地的公司都可以参与其中。我们绝对没有理由不采取欧盟的控制措施，如果我们继续落后的话，也会给与欧盟的贸易带来问题。”

;

;本周，;据透露;欧盟禁止使用数十种农药英国仍允许使用。

;
;

;;相关：;;英国未能禁止在欧盟禁止使用的 36 种有害农药;

;
;

;活动人士称英国化学品的延误监管计划意味着英国脱欧公投后部长们做出的承诺可能已被打破。 2017 年 6 月，环境审计委员会主席询问时任环境大臣迈克尔·戈夫，英国将如何监管化学品。 He gave a one word answer: “;Better;”.

;

;Green campaigners have highlighted that the UK helped the EU set up its chemicals regulation regime.

;

;Roz Bulleid, of the thinktank Green Alliance, said: “The UK played a key role in setting up the EU's gold standard chemicals regime, and yet now we are administering our own cut-price system and lagging behind the EU in tracking and regulating harmful substances. It shows that government promises of maintaining environmental protections through Brexit are not being kept to.

;

;“The government recently paved the way for the UK to rejoin the Horizon [research] programme. It surely makes sense for this government or the next to seek greater cooperation on chemicals and enhance protection for the public and our environment.”

;

;Wildlife groups have called for the government to align its restricted chemicals list with the EU's at the very least.

;

;Richard Benwell, the head of the Wildlife and Countryside Link, said: “Toxic chemicals that have been banned in the EU will continue to be allowed in the UK, with serious implications for wildlife and potentially public health. The Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs (Defra) is considering an expedited process to try to close the growing gap, but at the moment the best case scenario is to stagger behind the EU. Meanwhile, the long-promised chemicals strategy is nowhere to be seen.”

;

;He said Defra should adopt EU restrictions of hazardous chemicals unless there is strong evidence to the contrary, ban the most hazardous substances, and treat similar chemicals in groups, to prevent one substance being replaced by a similar one. “It should take a precautionary approach to reduce the risks of harmful mixtures before the chemical cocktail in our environment gets any worse.”

;

;A Defra spokesperson said: “UK Reach retains the fundamental approach and key principles of EU Reach, including ensuring a high level of protection of human health and the environment. Having our own independent regulatory framework for chemicals allows us to identify the most pressing priorities which best reflect the specific circumstances in Great Britain. As part of this, we are pursuing a programme of work on a wide range of hazardous substances to gather Great Britain-specific evidence of risks and exposure pathways.”

; Fri, 15 Sep 2023 17:52:01 +0800 Prospective AfD mayor ‘will be barred from Holocaust events’https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/15/prospective-afd-mayor-will-be-barred-from-holocaust-events-memorial-directors

;;Jörg Prophet
;

;Directors of a memorial at a former Nazi concentration camp have raised alarm about the revisionist views of a far-right politician expected to become its local mayor, saying he will be barred from attending events to commemorate the Holocaust if he is elected.

;

;Alternative für Deutschland (Alternative for Germany) politician Jörg Prophet last Sunday finished almost 20 points clear of the runner-up at municipal elections in Nordhausen, a city of about 42,000 in the eastern state of Thuringia.

;

;At the run-off vote on 24 September, Prophet could become the AfD's first city mayor in Germany, after the far-right party won its first district council and town mayorship in eastern Germany earlier this year.

;

;Jens-Christian Wagner, the director of the Buchenwald and Mittelbau-Dora Memorials Foundation, said a vote for Prophet would amount to “a clear turn away from the culture of commemorating the Holocaust, which has been constitutive for our federal republic”.

;

;In an article from April 2020, published on the anniversary of allied bombing of Nordhausen at the end of the second world war, Prophet said “the victors showed as little morality as the National Socialists” and claimed US troops had been motivated to liberate Mittelbau-Dora only to get hold of the rocket and missile technology manufactured in underground facilities at the site.

;

;The article, which is still up on the AfD politician's website, calls for an end to a German ;Schuldkult; or “guilt cult”, a far-right phrase used to describe the German tradition of commemorating the Holocaust.

;

;“If Prophet was already the mayor of Nordhausen, he would have had to resign over these comments alone,” said Wagner in a press conference on Thursday. He said while Prophet was welcome to visit the memorial site, he would be barred from attending commemorative events out of respect for the victims.

;

;In a 2017 beer-hall speech Björn Höcke, the AfD's state leader in Thuringia, called for a “180-degree turn” from the contemporary German culture of remembering and atoning for the Nazi era. A 2021 report by Germany's domestic intelligence agency classified the party as a proven rightwing extremist outfit in the state.

;

;Nonetheless, the AfD is polling 32% of the vote in the eastern state, which will elect a new regional government in September 2024.

;

;About 20,000 Jews and political prisoners people died at Mittelbau-Dora, a subcamp of the Buchenwald concentration camp that was operational between August 1943 and April 1945. After its liberation, photographs from inside the camp travelled around the world as some of the first pieces of visual evidence of Nazi atrocities.

;

;During British air raids on Nordhausen in April 1945, an estimated 8,800 people were killed, including some concentration camp prisoners and displaced people.

; Fri, 15 Sep 2023 16:52:01 +0800 Schiele artworks believed stolen during Holocaust seized from US museumshttps://www.theguardian.com/artanddesign/2023/sep/15/egon-schiele-artworks-believed-stolen-holocaust-seized-us-museums

;

;Three artworks believed stolen during the Holocaust from a Jewish art collector and entertainer have been seized from museums in three different states by New York law enforcement authorities.

;

;The artworks by the Austrian expressionist Egon Schiele were previously owned by Fritz Grünbaum, a cabaret performer and songwriter who died at the Dachau concentration camp in 1941.

;

;The art was seized on Wednesday from the Art Institute of Chicago, the Carnegie Museums of Pittsburgh and the Allen Memorial Art Museum at Oberlin College in Ohio.

;

;Warrants issued by the office of the Manhattan district attorney, Alvin Bragg, say there is reasonable cause to believe the three artworks are stolen property.

;

;The three works, and others from the collection, which Grünbaum began assembling in the 1920s, are already the subject of civil litigation on behalf of his heirs. They believe the entertainer was forced to cede ownership of his artworks under duress.

;

;Manhattan prosecutors believe they have jurisdiction in all of the cases because the artworks were bought and sold by Manhattan art dealers at some point.

;

;The son of a Jewish art dealer in what was then Moravia, Grünbaum studied law but began performing in cabarets in Vienna in 1906.

;

;A well-known performer in Vienna and Berlin by the time Adolf Hitler rose to power, Grünbaum challenged the Nazi authorities in his work. He once quipped from a darkened stage, “I can't see a thing, not a single thing; I must have stumbled into national socialist culture.”

;

;Grünbaum was arrested and sent to Dachau in 1938. He gave his final performance for fellow inmates on New Year's Eve 1940 while gravely ill, and died on 14 January 1941.

;

;The three pieces seized by Bragg's office are Russian War Prisoner, a watercolour and pencil-on-paper piece valued at $1.25m (£1m), which was seized from the Art Institute; Portrait of a Man, a pencil-on-paper drawing valued at $1m and seized from the Carnegie; and Girl With Black Hair, a watercolour and pencil-on-paper work valued at $1.5m and taken from Oberlin.

; ;

;The works will remain at the museums until they can be transported to the district attorney's office.

;

;The Art Institute said in a statement on Thursday: “We are confident in our legal acquisition and lawful possession of this work. The piece is the subject of civil litigation in federal court, where this dispute is being properly litigated and where we are also defending our legal ownership.”

;

;The Carnegie said it was committed to “acting in accordance with ethical, legal, and professional requirements and norms” and would cooperate with the authorities.

;

;In a statement, Oberlin said it was cooperating with investigators and was “confident that Oberlin College legally acquired Egon Schiele's Girl with Black Hair in 1958, and that we lawfully possess it”.

;

;“We believe that Oberlin is not the target of the Manhattan DA's criminal investigation into this matter,” the statement added.

;

;Before the warrants were issued, Grünbaum's heirs had filed civil claims against the three museums and several other defendants seeking the return of artworks they say were looted from Grünbaum.

;

;They won a victory in 2018 when a New York judge ruled that two works by Schiele had to be turned over to Grünbaum's heirs under the Holocaust Expropriated Recovery Act, passed by Congress in 2016.

;

;In that case, the attorney for the London art dealer Richard Nagy said Nagy was the rightful owner of the works because Grünbaum's sister-in-law, Mathilde Lukacs, had sold them after his death. But Judge Charles Ramos ruled that there was no evidence that Grünbaum had voluntarily transferred the artworks to Lukacs.

;

;“A signature at gunpoint cannot lead to a valid conveyance,” he wrote.

;

;Raymond Dowd, the attorney for the heirs in their civil proceedings, referred questions about the seizure of the three works on Wednesday to the district attorney's office.

;

;The actions taken by Bragg's office follow the seizures of what investigators said were ;looted antiquities from museums in Cleveland; and Worcester, Massachusetts.

;

;Douglas Cohen, a spokesperson for the district attorney, said he could not comment on the artworks seized except to say that they were part of an ongoing investigation.

; Fri, 15 Sep 2023 15:52:01 +0800 Social media firms ‘not ready to tackle misinformation’ during global electionshttps://www.theguardian.com/media/2023/sep/15/social-media-firms-not-ready-to-tackle-misinformation-during-global-elections

;;The logos of various social media apps.
;

;Social media companies are not ready to tackle misinformation during elections due to take place around the world in 2024 because of language barriers, experts warn.

;

;Global Coalition for Tech Justice, a movement of civil society leaders and survivors of tech harms, is calling on leading big tech companies, including Google, TikTok, Meta and X, to ensure that their platforms are equipped to protect democracy and safety during votes next year.

;

;In 2024, 2 billion people are due to vote in more than 50 elections, including in the US, India and the EU.

;

;In July, the coalition asked Google, Meta, X, and TikTok to establish fully resourced election action plans, at the global and country levels, for the protection of freedoms, rights and user safety during the 2024 elections. Social media companies did not respond to this request to share their plans.

;

;The coalition had sought details of the number of employees and contractors for each language and dialect to ensure there is expertise on national and regional context for content moderation.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Twitter chaos after Elon Musk takeover may have violated privacy order, DoJ alleges;

;
;

;Experts warn that if platforms do not have strong election action plans, it could risk the integrity of elections and the safety of citizens.

;

;Katarzyna Szymielewicz, co-founder and president of Panoptykon Foundation – a Polish NGO that monitors surveillance technology – said that big tech companies could do more to ensure that content is moderated across languages.

;

;“This is a big challenge for large platforms to do effective moderation in different cultural contexts, and the further from English language it gets, the more complicated it is.

;

;“Moderation of sponsored content, or organic content to eliminate political violence, misogynist content, various types of abuse are not so obvious when you just look at the language … The platforms should try harder to address this and invest a lot more in humans who can moderate more effectively.”

;

;Szymielewicz says that big tech platforms must de-amplify disinformation and hate by making their systems safe by design by default and not just during election periods. These include measures to suppress the algorithmic reach and visibility of disinformation and hate-spreading content, groups and accounts.

;

;South Africa has seen violence caused by; xenophobia on social media; targeted towards migrants, refugees and asylum seekers.

;

;In India, which has seen a new wave of anti-Muslim violence, the coalition claimed that Meta had flouted its own rules on hate speech propagated by the ruling Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata party (BJP).

;

;Ratik Asokan, a member of the diaspora organisation India Civil Watch International, a coalition member, said: “Meta hasn't come even close to policing its platforms in India because of lack of content moderators and due to its ties to the BJP.”

;

;“BJP has no incentive to take down hate speech because this is part of their politics, it contributes to their electoral success. The only people we could appeal to are turning a blind eye to this. Meta speaks the language of human rights but it is acting as an ally for the Hindu far right.”

;

;Meta, X, TikTok and Google were contacted for comment.

; Fri, 15 Sep 2023 13:22:01 +0800 Li Shangfu: speculation grows over fate of China’s missing defence ministerhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/15/china-defence-minister-li-shangfu-missing
;;2023-09-15T05:14:23Z;
;
;;Li Shangfu
;

;China's defence minister has not been seen in almost three weeks with speculation he is under investigation, the latest case of a senior Communist party official to disappear from public view.

;

;General Li Shangfu was last seen on 29 August when he gave a speech to the China-Africa peace and security forum. His last overseas trip was to Moscow and Minsk in mid-August, where he met Russian officials on the sidelines of a security conference, and with Belarusian president Alexander Lukashenko.

;

;The US government believes Li has been put under investigation, the Financial Times reported on Friday, citing senior officials. Reuters reported Li cancelled a meeting with Vietnamese defence officials at the last minute last week. Two Vietnamese officials told the news agency that Beijing had postponed the annual meeting.

;
;

;;Related: ;;China criticises 'malicious hype' over Qin Gang disappearance;

;
;

;Rahm Emanuel, the US ambassador to Japan, has been particularly vocal about the mystery, likening Xi's cabinet to Agatha Christie's novel And Then There Were None.

;

;On Friday he posted on X/Twitter claiming Li hadn't appeared at a scheduled meeting with the Singaporean chief of navy, because he was “placed under house arrest”. He did not provide a source for the claims.

;

;Emanuel's office and the Singaporean navy have been contacted for comment.

;

;Li's disappearance follows the surprise removal of foreign minister Qin Gang from his post ;in July;, also after a weeks-long disappearance. There has been no further information or sign of him since.

;

;Xi also replaced two top generals of the Rocket Force in early August, in a major shake-up of the military wing's leadership. Former commander Li Yuchao had not been seen in public for weeks prior, and there was no explanation of his removal.

;

;Since coming to power in 2013, Xi has run an extensive and unforgiving anti-corruption drive which analysts say also targeted political opponents. There has been a particular crackdown on corruption in the People's Liberation Army (PLA).

;

;But more than a decade into his rule, and after the greatest consolidation of power around a Chinese leader since Mao Zedong, senior ranks are now largely all Xi's allies.

;

;“It would be remarkable that in year 11 of Xi being in charge of the PLA there is still such high-level corruption, and for the Rocket Force officers and Li Shangfu, Xi can not blame his predecessors,” wrote China analyst Bill Bishop on Friday.

;

;Li was appointed defence minister in March 2023, after a few months as the highest-ranked member of the central military commission, which oversees the armed forces. In 2018, as director of the military's equipment development department he was sanctioned by the US over the PLA's purchase of Russian military equipment.

;

;Li's biography and title remained online at the time of publication. Following Qin's removal references to him as foreign minister were quickly scrubbed from Chinese internet sites, although some were later restored.

;

;In China's political system ministers are not the highest ranking in a particular portfolio. As defence minister, Li reports to two vice-chairmen in the central military commission, who then report to Xi. However he is also one of five state councillors, which ranks higher than a regular minister. Qin remains a state councillor.
